choices.answer: A describing word

questions.question: Which one of these examples is a simile?

choices.answer: The sun blinded me with its brightness
The sun was as hot as fire
The sun was blisteringly hot
The sun burnt me like a candle

questions.question: What is an example of a metaphor?

choices.answer: The football crowd roared like a lion
The football stadium erupted with cheers
The crowd were ecstatic
Everyone cheered loudly

questions.question: What is a list of three/listing/tricolon?

choices.answer: A list of objects/describing words in a sentence
A list of the writer's favourite thing
Sentence that is repeated
A question that doesn't need an answer
Two or more phrases beginning with the same letter
Words that sound the same
Makes you feel a certain emotion
Nothing it's just sad writing

questions.question: What is an example of emotive language?

choices.answer: I was sad
My heart felt like it had been ripped out of me
I was absolutely heartbroken, destroyed and emotionless

questions.question: What is an example of an imperative?

choices.answer: Please can you give an example?
You must give me an example now
If you'd like you can give an example you can
Give me an example now

questions.question: How can facts be important in texts?

choices.answer: They provide evidence and back up the writer
They make the text look better
They aren't really that important
They make the writer look good
Something that is exaggerated or heightened for effect
Someone is constantly hyper
Something that doesn't make sense
Something that is really upsetting to a reader
Zoom
Broom
Exciting
Crash
A writer who writes about petty things
Where the weather reflects the mood the writer is creating
Where the text is spooky
Where the text has a lot of action in it
A question
A question that doesn't need an answer
A question that is directed to the reader
A question about the reader

questions.question: What is an example of a pronoun?

choices.answer: You, me, he, she, they etc.
A describing word
A doing word
An object
Things you cannot touch like emotions - jealousy, beauty etc
Objects like a table or chair
General things
A name of a person
The name of people and places
The name of feelings and emotions
The name of objects
